definition: great heat/very popular
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: Today, "My ugly mother" big heat, "Auntie Cloud" worrying prospects.
sentences.chinese: 如今，《我的丑娘》大热，《云婶》前景堪忧。

sentences.english: Where did you actually find the much talked-about coat?
sentences.chinese: 事实上你是从哪弄来这些大热外套的？

sentences.english: The movie claims to be a sequel to the previous hit Painted Skin.
sentences.chinese: 《画壁》号称是上一部大热影片《画皮》的续集。

definition: popular/hot/in vogue
temperature/heat/short-lived enthusiasm
crispy fried chicken
at present/right now
to be a big hit/to be hugely popular
current favorite/the latest thing/darling (of the market or the media etc)
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
upsurge/popular craze
a neglected branch (of arts, science, sports etc)/fig. a complete unknown who wins a competition
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
recently/soon/nearest
to sell strongly/to be in great demand
to hit the big time
lit. burn your hand, feel the heat (idiom)/fig. arrogance of the powerful/a mighty figure no-one dares approach/hot (exciting or in favor)
dark horse/fig. unexpected winner
